title: White House Envoy Optimistic Port Talks to Produce Deal Soon
description: A tentative agreement covering longshore workers at the largest US ports is within reach after a year of negotiations between the union and employers, according to a Biden administration official involved in the talks.

title: Chile Holds Key Rate as Inflation Drop Proves Painfully Slow
description: Chile’s central bank held its benchmark interest rate steady for a fourth straight meeting and at its highest in more than two decades as policymakers remain cautious amid surprisingly stubborn core inflation.

title: Italy Survives Fitch Judgment in Boost for Meloni Before Moody’s
description: Italy retained a credit assessment two notches above junk from Fitch Ratings, a vote of confidence in the fiscal approach of Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni’s right-wing coalition.

title: California’s Newsom Slams Congress for ‘Dumb’ Immigration Policy
description: California Governor Gavin Newsom slammed US House Speaker Kevin McCarthy for the country’s broken immigration system as tens of thousands of migrants gather at the Mexico border and cities from New York to San Diego prepare for the arrival of thousands more.

title: Debt Limit Talks Move Into Back Channel as Leaders’ Meeting Put Off
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, White House reporter Josh Wingrove outlines where the debt-ceiling talks are headed. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics.

title: Spain’s Sanchez Says Biden Open to Solving Olive Tariff Dispute
description: Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez said President Joe Biden was open to a request to remove Trump-era duties on his country’s black olives.

title: US Appeals Steve Wynn Foreign-Lobbying Suit Dismissed by Judge
description: A US judge erred when deciding to toss out a lawsuit brought by the Justice Department that would have forced casino magnate Steve Wynn to register as a foreign agent, according to an appeal filed Friday in Washington.

title: Treasury Has Just $88 Billion of Measures Left to Avoid Debt Cap
description: The US Treasury Department said in a statement Friday that it had just $88 billion of extraordinary measures to help keep the government’s bills paid as of May 10.

title: EU Reaches Initial Agreement on Blueprint for China Relations
description: The European Union’s top envoys sought to project a united front on relations with China, reaching an initial consensus on a common blueprint for future ties although they still need to work out how to smooth out remaining differences.

title: California’s Newsom Sees Budget Deficit Deepening to $32 Billion
description: Governor Gavin Newsom said California is facing a $32 billion budget deficit, a deeper hole than previously projected, as the state grapples with the effects of rising interest rates, sagging stock markets and tech layoffs on its wealthiest taxpayers.

title: DeSantis Is Courting Donors at Secret Dinners With One Major Line: I’m the Drama-Free Trump
description: Ron DeSantis, at a series of private dinners in recent weeks, has intensified his pitch to conservative donors that he’s better suited than Donald Trump to advance their agenda in the 2024 presidential race.

title: As Pandemic-Era Border Restrictions End, US Doesn't See Fresh Migrant Surge
description: US authorities are seeing historic numbers of migrants arrive at the border with Mexico, but no fresh spike following the expiration of pandemic-era border restrictions.

title: Migrant Buses From Texas Arrive at Port Authority as NYC Braces for Surge
description: Two chartered buses from Laredo, Texas, rolled into the Port Authority just before 6:30 a.m. on Friday, transporting men, women and children who had traveled thousands of miles to New York City in a bid to gain asylum in the US.

title: US, EU to Boost Security Tools as G-7 Eyes Economic Coercion
description: The US and European Union will pledge to step up coordination on security measures like export restrictions, the screening of outbound technologies and foreign investment controls to fight back against economic coercion from countries such as China.

title: Blackouts May Cause South Africa’s ANC to Lose 24% of Its Voters, Poll Shows
description: South Africa’s ruling party risks losing almost a quarter of its support unless it brings the country’s worst power crisis to an end ahead of elections next year, a poll shows.

title: US Budget Deficit to Jump to $1.5 Trillion This Year, CBO Says
description: The nonpartisan Congressional Budget Office hiked its estimate for the US budget deficit by $130 billion for this year, now seeing the shortfall at $1.54 trillion, and renewed its warning that the Treasury could run out of sufficient cash as soon as early next month.

title: Macron Flags $7.3 Billion in Battery Investments in France
description: President Emmanuel Macron announced that French and Asian groups will invest €6.7 billion ($7.3 billion) in plants to produce electric-car batteries and related materials in Northern France, saying the moves vindicate his policies to boost the country’s attractiveness.

title: Turkcell on Defensive After Election Maintenance Memo Got Leaked
description: Turkey’s biggest mobile phone operator Turkcell is defending a decision to shut offices to most employees over the election weekend after it caused a furor on social media with plans for maintenance on voting day.

title: Ghana Gets China-Led Financing Assurances to Tap IMF Bailout
description: Ghana clinched financing assurances from a bilateral creditors group that China and France are co-chairing, paving the way for the International Monetary Fund’s board to approve a $3 billion bailout.

title: As US Border Crossings Jump, Biden Asks Latin America for Help. It’s a Tough Sell
description: President Joe Biden wants to share the burden of an increase in migration with other nations along the path to the US. But the response in Latin America has been clear: This is a problem that requires US policies and dollars to fix.

title: Iran Nuclear Monitors Express Concern After Inspections Plunge
description: Visibility into Iran’s nuclear program dimmed last year after the Persian Gulf nation removed cameras and surveillance equipment, raising international concern about the ability to carry out checks.

title: Orban Ramps Up Anti-EU Rhetoric by Asking ‘What’s the Point?’
description: Veszprem in Hungary is one of the European Union’s cities of culture this year, an initiative designed to foster cooperation and unity across the continent. On a visit there on Friday, Prime Minister Viktor Orban questioned whether there was a need for the EU at all.

title: Ukraine Says Its Troops Gain on Russian Forces Near Embattled Bakhmut
description: Ukrainian forces pushed Russian troops back to regain territory in the embattled eastern city of Bakhmut, officials in Kyiv said, as Russia’s Defense Ministry acknowledged a flurry of attacks along the frontline.

title: Rockets From Gaza Target Jerusalem as Cease-Fire Efforts Falter
description: Islamic Jihad militants in Gaza launched a fresh barrage of rockets at Israel, targeting Jerusalem for the first time since fighting erupted earlier this week.

title: Germany to Place Leopard Tank Order Worth Up to $3.2 Billion
description: Germany is poised to order 18 Leopard 2 main battle tanks to replace units sent to Ukraine with an option for 105 more at a total cost of around €2.9 billion ($3.2 billion), according to people familiar with the plan.

title: Europe Needs Stronger Line on China Relations, Ministers Urge
description: The European Union must unite around a stronger stance toward China as it tries to cope with Beijing’s rising power, several of the bloc’s foreign ministers said.

title: South Africa Plans Talks With Blinken, Envoy on Russia Arms
description: South Africa’s government summoned US Ambassador Reuben Brigety after he publicly accused Pretoria of supplying weapons to Russia, while its foreign minister intends to raise the matter with her American counterpart.

title: EU Proposes Formal Halt of Piped Russia Oil Flows To Germany, Poland
description: The European Union has proposed formalizing a halt of piped Russian oil flows to Germany and Poland.

title: Turkey’s Most Pivotal Vote in a Generation
description: Half the Turkish population is too young to have a clear memory of any other leader than President Recep Tayyip Erdogan.

title: Yellen Says She’s Had No Contact With Her New China Counterpart
description: Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said she hasn’t yet spoken with her opposite number in China, Vice Premier He Lifeng, as Biden administration officials work to re-engage and ease strains with the world’s second-largest economy.

title: GOP-Backed Laws Could Oust Local Prosecutors
description: In Georgia, Texas, Mississippi and other US states, there is a widening power struggle between Republican state lawmakers and elected Democratic district attorneys.

title: Sudan’s Warring Generals Agree to Civilian-Protection Pact
description: Sudan’s army and a rival paramilitary group signed an agreement to protect civilians and facilitate the delivery of humanitarian aid, but an end to their month-long conflict remains elusive.

title: Argentina Is Suffering Economic Carnage. This Hard-Liner Thinks She Has the Solution
description: As a former Argentine security minister, Patricia Bullrich is best known for her record of cracking down on drugs and violent crime. Now she’s trying to convert that steely reputation into votes for the presidency of a country on the edge of an economic precipice.

title: Biden Czar Warns Default Would Halt Key Infrastructure Projects
description: President Joe Biden’s infrastructure czar warns that popular projects will be jeopardized if the US government defaults or if the debt-limit standoff with Congress results in changes to funding sources.

title: Erdogan Fights for Turkey’s Youth Vote in Stage-Managed Q&A
description: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan took questions from a select audience of young people on some of the most contentious aspects of his time in power, in a carefully stage-managed appeal to first-time voters before Sunday’s election.

title: Pakistan Crisis, Putin’s War Dilemma: The Political Week in Photos
description: The showdown that’s fueled unrest across Pakistan is far from over after the government criticized the Supreme Court for releasing former premier Imran Khan from custody and vowed to find other reasons to arrest him.

title: Volkswagen’s Massive Subsidy From Trudeau Wins Support in Poll
description: A majority of Canadians support Prime Minister Justin Trudeau’s decision to give an enormous subsidy to Volkswagen AG to build a battery factory in the country, according to a new poll.

title: Yellen Says Only Good Outcome Is Congress Raising Debt Ceiling
description: Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said the only good outcome in the current US debt standoff is for Congress to raise the ceiling.

title: Ukraine Latest: China to Send Envoy to Kyiv; EU Ministers Meet
description: China will send a special envoy to Kyiv on Monday, marking the first high-level visit from the Chinese government since Russian President Vladimir Putin ordered his troops to invade Ukraine last year.

title: China to Send Special Envoy to Ukraine, Russia From Monday
description: China will dispatch a special envoy to Ukraine, Russia and other European nations from Monday, as Beijing steps up its efforts for a diplomatic resolution to Moscow’s war.

title: What You Need to Know About Thailand Election Pitting Old Guard Against New Generation
description: Thailand is headed for an election that could help reverse a slump in its $506 billion economy.

title: Meet the Contenders Vying to Become Kenyan Central Bank Governor
description: Six candidates are vying to succeed Patrick Njoroge as the governor of Kenya’s central bank, a changeover that comes as the East African nation contends with stubbornly high inflation and a depreciating currency.

title: US-China Talks Gives Hope to Investors After Tumultuous Period
description: Asia investors got a fresh reason to be bullish Friday on news that top US and Chinese officials met as they tried to ease existing strains between the two countries.

title: City Stunned by War Learns to Live Alongside a Feared Militia
description: Khartoum was mostly peaceful while violence raged in other parts of Sudan. That all ended last month when fighters from Darfur arrived.

title: G-7 Finance Chiefs to Add New Supply-Chain Proposal in Statement
description: Finance chiefs from the world’s rich economies are set to propose a new partnership on supply chains that’ll be open to other nations and would require countries to have minimum standards on human rights and environmental policies to join.

title: Thai Military Rules Out Coup After Election as Campaigning Ends
description: Thailand’s army chief said there was “zero chance” of the Southeast Asian nation returning to a military rule in the event of post-election turmoil as politicians were set to make a final push to woo voters ahead of the election on Sunday.

title: China, Australia Trade Ministers Meet in Beijing to Ease Dispute
description: China and Australia’s trade ministers will hold their first in-person economic dialog since 2019 on Friday as Canberra hopes to negotiate an end to sanctions on billions of dollars worth of its agricultural exports.

title: Pakistan Latest: Government Slams Court for Freeing Imran Khan
description: Pakistan’s government criticized the Supreme Court for releasing former premier Imran Khan from custody and vowed to find other ways to arrest him, signaling the showdown that’s fueled unrest across the country is far from over.

title: Philippine Court Acquits Duterte Critic in Drug Case
description: A Philippine court has acquitted former Senator Leila de Lima for a drug case, marking a key win for ex-President Rodrigo Duterte’s staunch critic who’s been detained for six years.
